Position.Label: Freelance External Contractor in Mission Analysis

WorkExperience.Activities:
• Design and development of a new software infrastructure for lunar exploration missions.
  • Maintenance and extension of the FASTOP software tool for launcher ascent trajectory optimization.
  • Evaluation of modern programming languages for next-generation astrodynamics software systems.​

Employer.Name: European Space Agency - European Space Operations Centre

WorkExperience.Activities:
• Projects

    • Industry Cooperation with Airbus Group (2015-2016)

      • Evaluation and benchmarking of LOTAR-compliant product data archiving systems.

    • ​DFG-funded research project SCoPE - Smart Components within Smart Production Processes and Environments (2014)

      • Development of an integrated component data model in cooperation with two Brazilian universities (UNIMEP, Poli-USP)

  • Teaching

    • Organisational and teaching support for the lecture Virtual Product Development C - Product and Process Modelling

Employer.Name: Technische Universität Darmstadt - Department of Computer Integrated Design

WorkExperience.Activities: • Design and development of the Fortran-based FASTOP software tool for launcher ascent trajectory optimization and payload assessment.​

Employer.Name: European Space Agency - European Space Operations Centre

WorkExperience.Activities:
• Mission Analysis Section

    • Reconstruction of the Apollo 15 trajectory on behalf of ESAC for the re- evaluation of science data.

  • Gaia Spacecraft Operations

    • Implementation of a Long-Term Mission Planning Tool intended for Mission Planning System validation and as backup during operations.​​

Employer.Name: European Space Agency - European Space Operations Centre

Education.Title: Doctor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering
Education.Activities:
• Research in model-based engineering, data modelling​, and computational science.

  • Thesis: Model-Based Space Mission Design (working title)​

    • Completion expected Februrary 2017
    • ​Advisor: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Reiner Anderl

Education.Title: Master's Degree in Mechanical and Process Engineering
Education.Activities:
• Thesis: Knowledge-Based Simulations Models for Payload Assessment of Launch Systems

    • Advisor: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Reiner Anderl​

Education.Title: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical and Process Engineering
Education.Activities:

    • Advisor: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Cameron Tropea​

JobRelated.Description:
• Software Development & Architecture Modelling

    • Julia (expert), Fortran (expert), Python (expert), Matlab (expert), C/C++ (intermediate), Java​ (intermediate)
    • UML, SysML, BPMN

Achievement.Description:
• Eichhorn, Helge; Cano, Juan Luis; McLean, Frazer; Anderl, Reiner: A Comparative Study of Programming Languages for Next-Generation Astrodynamics Systems. In: 6th International Conference on Astrodynamics Tools and Techniques (ICATT), 14.-17.3.2016, Darmstadt.
  • Eichhorn, Helge; Anderl, Reiner: Plyades: A Python Library for Space Mission Design. URL: http://arxiv.org/abs/1607.00849. In: Proceedings of the 8th European Conference on Python in Science (EuroSciPy 2015) pp. 9-12.
